results.title: Help is
results.creator_credit: Ross McConnell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: First aid at the roadside - a clear demonstration of what the first person, or persons, on the scene of a motor vehicle accident should do during those critical minutes before ambulance and police arrive. A comprehensive film, dealing not only with on-the-spot treatment of injuries, but with the individual responsibility of every motorist in today’s total traffic picture. It was produced with the counsel of federal and provincial medical and traffic authorities.

results.title: Helicopter management: fire
results.brief_description: The helicopter is widely used in all phases of forest fire control in America. This training film is designed to assist personnel in planning, organising and directing helicopter operations safely and efficiently.

results.title: Helen Keller in her story
results.creator_credit: Richard Carver Wood, Nancy Hamilton and Butterfield and Wolf Inc
results.brief_description: This inspiring film received an Academy Award for the best feature documentary of 1956, A biography of Helen Keller, it traces her life from her birth to her mid seventies - when this documentary was made. As a small child, she was left totally blind and deaf by an illness. For years she was cut off from the rest of the world, until Ann Sullivan taught her to read braille, read lips and talk. This film shows excerpts from the silent docudrama: “Deliverance” in which she starred. Also contains the only newsreel footage of Ann Sullivan. Narrated by Katherine Cornell. Music by Morgan Lewis.

results.title: The Hela cell strain: cervical carcinoma
results.brief_description: Part of the Living Human Cells in Culture series. The film is introduced with a sequence of tissue preparation for photography, and then shows the physiological characteristics of Hela cells, a malignant strain of cervical origin. Among the processes shown are cell drinking, nuclear rotation, mitosis and the action of filapodia in intercellular communications.

results.title: Heki-un-so and Kyoto
results.brief_description: A visit to the ancient city of Kyoto which is the cradle of ten centureis of history and tradition. Shows the beautiful Heki-un-so gardens, created in the traditional Japanese style, during the four seasons of the year, as well as many examples of ancient and modern Japanese buildings, a tea ceremony and many ceremonies and festivals which are part of the way of life in this ancient capital city of Japan.

results.title: The Hecklers
results.brief_description: Politicians under pressure during the 1966 election campaign in Britain. The camera goes to meetings up and down the country with an eye to angry and excited audiences. Suggests the heat, rather than the light, of a campaign. It is crammed with off-beat observation and fascinating side-lights on the techniques of leading politicians.

results.title: Heat treatment of aluminum. Part 2
results.brief_description: Explains the nature of cold working operations; crystalline structure of aluminum alloys; slip planes and deformation; microstructure changes during cold working; microstructure changes during annealing; cold working operations; and annealing operations.

results.title: Heat rays
results.brief_description: Instructional film analysing the relationship between heat and light radiation; the sun as a source of light and heat, making a photograph with light and heat rays; applications and uses of heat rays; reflection, refraction and movement of heat rays; applications of these properties of heat rays to everyday life; relationships between heat and light as a form of vibration of electro-magnetic waves of different frequencies; the role of heat rays in maintaining life on this planet.

results.title: Hearts of the world
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith, D W Griffith Productions and War Office Committee
results.brief_description: After producing BIRTH OF A NATION and INTOLERANCE Griffith was commissioned by the American government to produce a propaganda film for the Allies in World War 1. Although not in the same class as his two masterpieces, HEARTS OF THE WORLD is nevertheless well in the Griffith tradition of striking sets, visual flair and spectacular battle scenes. A group of youngsters grow up and love in a peaceful French village. But war intrudes and peace is shattered. The German army invades and occupies village, bringing both destruction and torture. The young people of the village resist, some successfully, others tragically, until French troops retake the town. Stars Lillian Gish, Robert Harron, Dorothy Gish, Adolphe Lestina and Josephine Crowell. Noel Coward and Erich von Stroheim play small parts.
